titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the E.S. 80 Night School scrapbooks 2008.020
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:40:48 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection consists of two scrapbooks which were created by night school students (recent immigrants and refugees learning English) at E.S. 80 in the Coney Island neighborhood of Brooklyn in the 1940s. The documents produced by the students touch upon American history, World War II experiences, their home countries, life in New York, and opinions on the school.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Class work will enter public domain 70 years after the author's death, or in 2068 if the author's date of death is unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); E.S. 80 Nigh School scrapbooks, 2008.020, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: E.S. 80 was located in the Coney Island neighborhood of Brooklyn, on West 19th Street, near Neptune Avenue. It was demolished sometime around 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two scrapbooks which were created by night school students (recent immigrants and refugees learning English) at E.S. 80 in the Coney Island neighborhood of Brooklyn in the 1940s. The documents produced by the students touch upon American history, World War II experiences, their home countries, life in New York, and opinions on the school.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
